titles.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the submission to Congress and the public of the identity of any individual for whom a waiver of the eligibility requirements for interment in Arlington National Cemetery is granted, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.summary: 1/27/1998--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Army, in the case of any individual for whom the Secretary waives the eligibility requirements for interment in Arlington National Cemetery, to: (1) furnish the name of such individual to the Senate and House Veterans' Affairs Committees; and (2) publish such name in the Federal Register. Mandates that such requirements be met before interment, or, in special circumstances, within five days after such interment. Directs the Secretary to: (1) provide such committees the names of persons requesting such a waiver each year; and (2) notify any person requesting such a waiver of the reporting requirements of this Act.
